name: pascal
text: Fast fact, "krik" is the all purpose noise Onstad uses for neck-snaps. Example, see the Todd Creation Myth when he drops a stork.

name: flynn
text: Someone ought to make an Achewood tally along such lines. Number of necks snapped, bozacks shown, number of times Phillipe has been brought to tears by the aforementioned or other.

name: lateadopter
text: That's one of the things I hope for most from this Acheworld thing.  If they add meta-tags or the ability to search these comments, we could build up a catalog of themes and tropes just by pointing them out as we notice them.

name: tttt2
text: yeah let's care about weird things

name: lexsenthur
text: Some ain't need to be stoned to have strange cares.

name: nktalloth
text: what else is there, really

name: epicurus
text: Channels 3 and 4 are awesome.

name: stuart
text: They're the multi-purpose channels you'd set up your Nintendo to show up on. An area can have one or the other... but not both .

name: epicurus
text: A comment left by epicurus was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by JimTS, Fielding, yomimono)

name: peterjoel
text: It would be a little bit wrong if you were reading achewood, while not being a little bit fucked, now wouldn't it.

name: epicurus
text: The truly sad thing is that, looking back, I can't recall if I was actually drunk when I posted that or not.

name: heccibiggs
text:
Well, one comment was 9 months ago and the other was 6 months ago, so unless you were claiming to having been so FUCKEd right now for three months... I'm not really sure your defense made sense.

Haha I rhymed. She Gets With Ladies But In The End They Do Not Like Her!

name: epicurus
text: I probably shouldn't bother with this, but my possible explanation is that I was sober when I wrote "channels" and then later got home from a bar or something and achewood was open and I came across the comment. In other words, there is probably no connection between "Dude I totally said "channels" " and "I am so fucked right now" - those are just two different observations made by a drunken man.

name: dissembly
text:
THAT is AWESOME. God. Whe i introduce friends to this comic, it will have to be whole they are stoned or drunk.

All looking over their shoulder taking the mouse, clicking through the archives randmnly, saying "Wait wait... you gotta read this one... this one is... wait wait... this is life man... this is HOW IT WORKS... wait..."

Clicking onto the next comic before they even get a glimpse of the last one. "No wait... this one man..." All laughing without seeing anything but blurs.

name: the_stoned_one
text:
Sir I commend you!
also a shiny new chubby from me to you

name: gazdatronik
text: If you get rid of the grey box and wire it straight from the nintendo, You can get 3 and 4 at the same time. I found this out when I didnt have that connector so I had to make do with paperclips and speaker wire.

name: tombsgrave
text: No-No has slippery little hands.  They're like eels.  Snappin' eels.

name: hellofyellin
text: Panel five scares me.  A lot.

name: hellofyellin
text: No-no is just so... expectant.

name: lateadopter
text:
I bet No-No sized Beef up for murder the moment he saw him.

Oh, wait, I can't say that. That's the alt text.

name: twohundredninety
text:
I didn't notice how really creepy that is until I read your comment.

But damn is it ever. I love how atmospheric Achewood can be.

name: gtc
text: My mind shut down in terror after panel 4.

name: greyfield
text: See guys, the only thing required to get out of heaven is OH GOD WHAT ARE YOU DOING

name: centipede_damascus
text: Trouble Man commissions the murder acts, and No-no delivers the goods.

name: cailetshadow
text:
No-No is one who also Gets Things Done.

Different things though.

name: flynn
text: Is No-No wearing a diaper, underwears, or is his business bandaged?

name: moraiat
text: It looks to be underwear, in the "tight-white" style.

name: cracklewater
text: Could be a Jesus-on-the-cross loin cloth.

name: sol_tee
text: his foot is bandaged from kicking too much ass

name: turnabout
text: Murdered in heaven. Seems kind of redundant.

name: dasilodavi
text: Hey, uh, what DID Molly die of the first go-around?

name: zem
text: too much ocean in the lungs I'd guess

name: zaratustra
text: Water poisoning

name: professorhazard
text: Shark.

name: ovenface
text: dihydrogenmonoxide poisoning is no laughing matter.

name: cailetshadow
text: I love how blurry the line between life and death is in Achewood. And how strange are the gateways that lead back and forth.

name: tellumo
text: How Strange Are The Gateways is my favorite Yes album.

name: dovey
text: The addition of eyebrows and movements lines turn No-No from vaguely humorous-looking into a thing of which nightmares are made

name: stormagnet
text: The slow, sinuous creeping of panels 4-6 creeped me out far, far worse than the culmination. Something about the way those frames translated to movement in my head...

name: heccibiggs
text: I know, right. Those eyebrows are the scariest damn things.

name: ham_shoes
text: No-No is like a Jim Woodring character.

name: luckypyjamas
text: no-no was ready and willing

name: paco
text: Check it out. As No-No preforms the act of murder, he suddenly is wearing a tie.

name: slanger
text: I think it's the side of his body

name: i_love_kate
text: Nah, I prefer Paco's way. We're going to go with that.

name: apocowarg
text: Yes, I agree, he is wearing a Magical Murder Tie.

name: budenhagen
text: Was there ever an official strip wherein Trouble Man and No-No were named?

name: stuart
text: This one.

name: epicurus
text: I didn't appreciate it before, but looking quickly from the before-last to the last panel, the motion and violence of Beef's (reverse?) death are pretty well-conveyed.

name: kelissamunz
text: The sudden appearance of No-No's vivid white eyebrows terrifies me.

name: unsentletter
text:
Still horrifies me.

There's an insinuation of speed across those last panels and it's stomach turning... you can almost hear No-No's breath on Beef's neck.

name: alaric101
text: Chilling. =5

name: mustakrakesh
text: Brutal man, just brutal.

name: nickb285
text: No-No creeps me the fuck out. Honest to god bad dreams resulted from this strip. No-No all just slithering up behind me.

name: lawdog
text: Who knew there was so much Math in death?

name: funkmessiah
text:
OH GOD RIGHT AS I WAS READING THE LAST FOUR PANELS ROB HALFORD HAD TO SAY
DON'T LOOK BEHIND YOU, NIGHT CRAWLER!

name: tonyhighwind
text: What?

name: sleaw
text: Rob Halford is the current vocalist for Judas Priest. Funkmessiah is saying that he was listening to the song 'Night Crawler' as he read this, and song & comic synched in a creepy way! I think.

name: tonyhighwind
text: Oh!  Thank you.

name: apocowarg
text: Either that or Rob Halford snuck up behind him while he was on his computer, put one clammy hand on his neck and whispered it into his ear. I prefer to think it happened like that.

name: puguglypress
text: I like how these strips have been alternating between Phillipe's campaign and Beef's creepy experience. It's a good balance here

name: andrewthepig
text: It makes me wonder if Trouble Man & No-No burned the place down...

name: duperando
text: I just realized that No-No kind of reminds me of a giant version of Todd. Maybe that's why I like him so much. Also, his cast is hilarious looking.
